text:
68 to 60 South Street, west side, south from and including Pine, to and including Wall Streets. This block front is now (1937), occupied by the 120 Wall Street Building.

February 22, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

A part of the same, showing only Nos. 68 to 63, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Pine Street.

February 22, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

The same as view No. 1, (but looking northward from Wall Street), showing work in progress on the foundation for the No. 120 Wall Street Building. The creation of the site for the new building also necessitated the demolition of houses Nos. 120 to 114 Wall Street and Nos. 97 and 99 Pine Street.

May 13, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

69 and 70 South Street, west side, from and including Pine (left), to and including Depyster (right), Streets.

February 22, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE NORTH AND SOUTH

70-60 South Street, west side, from, but not including Depyster (right), not shown), to Wall Street (extreme left). These houses (with the exception of the two on the extreme right), have been demolished, and their site is now (1937), occupied by the 120 Wall Street Building.

February 22, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

71-75 South Street, west side, north from, and including Depeyster Street, to, but not including Maiden Lane. Nos. 71-72 and 73-74, are United States bonded warehouses.

February 23, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

The same, at a later date.

April 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

A portion of the same, showing only Nos. 71-72, and part of Nos. 73-74. Also shown (left background), is the Farmer's Loan and Trust Co. Building.

April 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

May 11, 1930.

South Street, west side, north from and including Pine Street.
April 23, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE NORTH AND SOUTH

(1)
East River, showing (right to left) piers 14, 15 and 16, off South Street, north from Depyster to John Streets. Also shown (background) is the skyline of Brooklyn as seen from No. 1 Cedar Street.

July 7, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, as seen from 111 John Street.

July 8, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a later date, as seen from No. 60 Wall Street.

July 1, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

East River, showing piers 14 to 21 (right to left), off South Street, north from Depeyster to Dover Streets, as seen from 120 Wall Street. Also shown is the shore of Brooklyn and (left) the Manhattan Bridge.

April 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at an earlier date.
October 3, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

title: East River - Piers 14-18.

text:
Depyester Street, south side, west from South, across Front, to Water Street. The vacant space seen was the former site of buildings that extended thru this narrow block and bore No's. 94 to 98 Pine Street and 30 to 34 Depyester Street. In the background spire of the Bank of Manhattan Building and the lower stories of the 60 Wall Tower building.

September 13, 1938.

P. L. Sperr

Pine Street, looking westwards from South Street.
Victor Volnar
no date
